text:
JavaServer Pages Specification 1.2 Section JSP 10.1 
"Empty and Non-Empty Actions" (page 161)

"An empty action has no body; it may use one of two syntaxes:
either <foo/> or <foo></foo>.  Since empty actions have no body
the methods related to body manipulation are not invoked....."

Jasper is allowing the invocation of body-related methods.

Example from Watchdog-4.0
src/server/jsp-tests/jsp/tagext/TagSupport/positiveDoAfterBody. jsp

<snip>

<%@ taglib uri="/TestLib.tld" prefix="test"  %>
<test:iterator iteration="0" />
<test:iterator iteration="2"  />
<test:iterator iteration="4"  />
<test:iterator iteration="1" />
<test:iterator iteration="3" />

</snip>

The code for the iterator tag will return Tag.EVAL_BODY_INCLUDE for every
call to doStartTag(), this will in turn invoke doAfterBody(), but this shouldn't
happen as none of the actions have a body.
creator: Ryan.Lubke@Sun.COM
kin-man.chung@sun.com
text: This was fixed in Tomcat 4.0 head branch, so the fix should be in 4.1.
